page.title: 04ETTRICK SHEPHERD,JAMES HOGG.
page.content: James Hogg the Ettrick Shepherd famous for his poetry and prose was born in 1770 in a cottage which was built on the site of the James Hogg monument. He went to school for only a year but when he went to work as a shepherd,12 years later when he was 18,his employer at that time encouraged him to read and write. He met Walter Scott at Blackhouse in Yarrow and that was the begining of a life long friendship which ended when they met for the last time at the Gordon Arms in 1830. James Hogg died in the November of 1835 but has been rembered ever since especialy for poems about the fairy people and his famous prose The Confessions of a Justified Sinner.
